tripreview.Title: "Beautiful church"
tripreview.sentence: Beautiful church located in Fort Kochi area.
Liked the architecture and the old paintings on the ceiling.
Reminded my of old european cathedrals.
Great place to medicate and pray.

tripreview.Title: "Serene!"
tripreview.sentence: A very beautiful Basilica located in the heart of Fort Kochi area near the Parade road.
Great architecture combined with beautiful paintings,sculptures and other imagery from the Bible make this a must visit for history buffs.
The serenity within and outside the Cathedral only adds to the experience.
Travellers bear in mind that on Sundays visitors aren't allowed inside during religious services.
Also on the first friday of every month the Basilica is closed to tourists.
Remember to dress appropriately and switch off your moblie phones.

tripreview.Title: "Finest place to have inner silence..."
tripreview.sentence: Beautiful church, with paintings as old as the 18th century.
Old pulpit used in 18th century.
Tiles and goethic paintings are worth seeing.
Lot of statues of saints all over.

tripreview.Title: "snakeboat in Ginger restaurant!"
tripreview.sentence: the Jew town is basically tourist trap for cheap rubbish all the way to the synagogue.
the synagogue is very interesting even for the non Jews, piece of dyeing history!
if you are lucky you will meet Sara Cohen the last Jew alive!

tripreview.Title: "Good shopping beside the Paradesi synagogue"
tripreview.sentence: This is a fun quaint and scenic shopping area located between the Mattancherry Palace and the Jewish Synagogue.

tripreview.Title: "great place to shop and wander"
tripreview.sentence: got to Kochi at the end of a 2 week tour of southern india.
Fascinating place - but extremely humid during our visit.
Jew Town was very laid back and a great place to visit.
We did some serious bargaining and enjoyed the experience.
Most of the shops are run by Kashmiri Indians and their wares reflect their state.
we really enjoyed the experience.

tripreview.Title: "A huge historical location very poorly presented"
tripreview.sentence: By all means, worth visiting to check off a very old Jewish synagogue.
But the whole tour will last about 15 minutes--it is a tiny space and there is very little by way to the usual tourist-friendly resources for you to dwell.
The street leading up to the place is full of kitschy stores.

tripreview.Title: "Where have all the Jews gone?"
tripreview.sentence: I came here first in 1970 and the street was lined with little traditional shops with Jewish names above the doors.
Now it's been taken over by Kashmiri emporiums selling clothes and "antiques", with not a Jewish name in sight.
It's just a tourist trap and has lost all its character, so I'm sorry I came back.

tripreview.Title: "Go early... "
tripreview.sentence: This was a good trip to take
Our guide was great and explained everything.
We even met Mrs Cohen one of the last Jewish woman left in Jew Town.
The synagogue was well kept.
The shopping was fun
Such haggling.
The scarves and cotton was amazing.
Go early, it was so hot by 10am.

tripreview.Title: "Jews Town"
tripreview.sentence: Very interesting attractions, spices being the largest items, one of the oldest trading connections to Europe and Gulf for many centuries.
One should take time to understand these which need minimum 3 hours about this market, mainly managed by Jews, which one can not find these days any where else.

tripreview.Title: "Nostalgia in Kochi"
tripreview.sentence: I have brought a couple of Jewish here and they have always been awed by the rich cultural heritage.

tripreview.Title: "History Of Migration"
tripreview.sentence: The Jews from Kodungallore were given shelter by the King of Kochi, in 1524.
He allocated land in Mattancherry, near his palace, to them.
This area later became Jew Town.
Jew Town is the narrow street between Mattancherry Palace and the Pardesi Synagogue.
It is famous for the antique shops all along its sides.
The colonial buildings lining the street add to its old-world charm.
There are many shops like antiques, sculptures, handmade toys, embroidered garments, floral oils, and chandeliers.

tripreview.Title: "Jew street is part of a great migrant history"
tripreview.sentence: Jew Town /street is a place located at Mattancherry part of the Kochi (Cochin City), in the state of Kerala, India.

This is the place where the early Jew migrants ( migrated around the year AD 72 settled down in palace near cochin (Kochi) ) from various countries like; Jerusalem, Spain,Portuguese and some other countries and migrated again (during 15th ~16th century) and settled down in the present Jew town/Street area of Kochi and established their business (mainly trading in Spices) and build their Paradesi Synagogue ( Jews place of worship) and now one of the oldest Synagogue in the world.

Jew street is a historical narrow lane/ street with Dutch style residences, now occupied by various shops ( entry of vehicles beyond certain point is banned), and a famous address for shoppers ( both Indians and Oversees tourists), shops selling antiques,carved wooden furnitures,traditional hand embroidered dress material,bed sheets,table cloths and towels.

While the earlier antique sellers around here were mostly decedents of the original Jew migrants, owner ship's have changed, due to the decrease in the original decedents, since most of them have migrated to Israel and other countries and hardly few are left.

There are a few decent restaurants around to satisfy your appetite and at a walking distance, one can visit the Dutch Palace and the boat jetty is also there in front of the palace, from where one can travel cheap to the mainland.
Jew street is part of a great history ( by migrant Jew settlers ) with its tidy street and with its oldest Synagogue and a visit is recommended to fell/ view the part of great history.

tripreview.Title: "Cool part of town"
tripreview.sentence: A great place in the quieter part of Cochin.
Nice place to walk around in Fort Cochin.
A good break from the hustle and bustle of town.

tripreview.Title: "Enjoy"
tripreview.sentence: It is a very good place to visit, nice shop owners, not too much hassel.
Not crowded , clean, close to Fort House where we were staying.

tripreview.Title: "Lovely area"
tripreview.sentence: Nice area and great for tourist shopping!
synagogue was very peaceful, and good to see.

tripreview.Title: "Memorable walk"
tripreview.sentence: The area around the pardesi synagogue is the Jew Town.
This place also has the ferry terminal to take you to Island or mainland.
Great place to take a walk and indulge in some window shopping.

tripreview.Title: "Best shopping in Fort Cochin!"
tripreview.sentence: This area had the best shops of all of Fort Cochin, with more out-of-the-ordinary and interesting items.

tripreview.Title: "Nice walk down the narrow streets"
tripreview.sentence: Nice to look around and browse through the narrow streets of the Jew town area.
In particular the various names of the buildings surrounding the precinct.

tripreview.Title: "Frozen in Time"
tripreview.Userloc: National Capital Territory of Delhi, India
tripreview.sentence: Beautiful Jew Town with well preserved buildings, shops and clean tidy streets is amazing.
Highly recommended for a short visit.
The post office is also must visit.

tripreview.Title: "As enjoyable as shopping can be"
tripreview.sentence: As one for whom shopping is very low on my travel agenda, it is unavoidable in most cases.
Gifts for family and friends, and opportunities to pick up bargains require at least some shopping.
Shopping in Jew Town is certainly less painful than in the rest of Cochin.
It is quieter, cleaner, and for pedestrians only.
The store keepers are less aggressive than in other areas - a very welcome aspect.
In short, if you like to or have to shop, this is a very good option.

tripreview.Title: "History and Shopping"
tripreview.sentence: One of the important and touristic areas of Cochin.
There is lots of shops but my suggestions keep away from them.
They are too expensive and unworthy.

tripreview.Title: "Shopping for clothes"
tripreview.sentence: If you ever need a hand sewn blouse, especially white one, this is the place for you.
But, remember, bargaining for the price is a must.

tripreview.Title: "History and Trade"
tripreview.sentence: The three of us took an auto rickshaw from our hotel to Jew Town which is a small piece of old Cochin steeped in history.
The land was granted to the first Jewish settlers by the then Maharaja some 450 years ago and the centrepiece is the Jewish Synagogue which was built in 1568.
Today it is a commercial area selling local handicrafts, fabrics, old coins and stamps, woodwork, furniture, etc.
Most of the shops have signage stating "hassle free" which is humorous.
We did not buy any items but enjoyed the walkabout and the visit to the Synagogue.

tripreview.Title: "It was closed "
tripreview.sentence: We want around lunch time it was closed.
it had lot of merchants trying to sell Kashmiri stuff in Cochin!
So it was not great trip .

tripreview.Title: "Shopping"
tripreview.sentence: This is located in the matancherry area.
There is nothing much to see here but there are many stalls here where one can buy handicrafts.
Traditional Indian clothes can also be bought here.
A good place to visit.

tripreview.Title: "Quaint Town"
tripreview.sentence: Good place to shop for genuine spices.
Handicrafts are common to what is available in rest of India too.
For those who haven't been inside of a synagogue n have always been curious ,worth a visit.
The Palace turned Museum is worth a visit to learn about local history.

tripreview.Title: "Not Much"
tripreview.sentence: There are so many visitors here but there is not much to see here.
But it is interesting to have Jewish town in India.
The synagogue has some fee, and photo is strictly forbidden.

tripreview.Title: "Stalls "
tripreview.sentence: Lots of stalls selling the same stuff.

Contrary to other reviews there is a big sign above the stalls at the palace exit, stating that they are NOT government run or approved initiatives/sellers, that you are welcome to view them all freely but it is not a cottage industry and no money is put back into an initiative to help locals.

tripreview.Title: "Best place for spice and handicraft shopping"
tripreview.sentence: Small streets dotted with shops on either side of the road selling spices and handicrafts -- that's Jew Town for you.

tripreview.Title: "Mostly a commercial area"
tripreview.sentence: This is a quaint part of Kochi, which is unfortunately ruined by commercialism and tourism.
What I am sure was a lovely place to admire the old Jewish architecture and bylanes is now packed with shops on all sides.
The shopkeepers mainly tend to, and thrive on foreigners, so if you are an Indian, they will usually not give you a second glance.
I was interested in buying a couple of items, but decided not to as I was appalled by some of the shopkeepers' attitude.
Secondly, the price is way to high.
Having said that, this place has a couple of small cozy coffee shops and is a good place to while away an afternoon watching people and life go by.

tripreview.Title: "At least it is pedestrian only!"
tripreview.sentence: Nothing particularly exceptional about these shops and their wares, with the exception of being free of traffic and noise.

tripreview.Title: "Shopper's haven"
tripreview.sentence: Jew street is great if you're in the mood to shop.
There is a variety in the things you can buy.
There are books, clothes, antiques and an array of other art.
A lot of this art is not local.
The prices here are steep but the street is gorgeous.

tripreview.Title: "Walk around Jew Town"
tripreview.sentence: We were dropped off here to explore this part of the city.
We were also earned that a lot of the good on sale were not genuine - so beware.
Also watch out for Tuc Tuc drivers wanting to take you to shops/ malls etc to get (free) diesel!
Make sure you haggle and understand the value of items you buy.
They'll want to charge 10,000 for something worth 2,000.
'Old' items have been 'aged' and are a 'con' - be aware!
Having said that, there's some good cheap stuff for sale and there are deals to be done.

tripreview.Title: "Not great"
tripreview.sentence: Except for the synagogue, the rest is not that interesting.
Lots of annoying shop sellers with the same stuff as elsewhere.

tripreview.Title: "Sort visit"
tripreview.sentence: Not worth the visit apart from hawkers trying to sell you goods.

tripreview.Title: "A pleasant enough row of touristy shops"
tripreview.sentence: You'll have to go down this street if you visit the synagogue, and apparently the shops here are government approved.

Nothing particularly called out to us so we didn't give the merchandise more than a fairly cursory glance - we weren't in India to shop - and the vendors are so desperate to get you in, you don't want to get their hopes up.
But they were humorous enough and when we parried their exhortations with jokey replies, they laughed and let us go on.
So we didn't feel too hassled which was good.

tripreview.Title: "Experience the Real old Kochi"
tripreview.sentence: A place with air filled with fragrance of spices like cardamom and pepper etc.
(May be to some it's intence).
Now I know why Jews, Europeans and Arabs flocked to Kochi in Malabar coast.
Worth a walk , please read some interesting old name board and houses built centuries back.

tripreview.Title: "A calm place "
tripreview.sentence: It's a calm and nice place with rows of shops at both sides.

tripreview.Title: "Narrow and congested"
tripreview.sentence: The place is congested and lot of small shops.
Narrow lanes make it difficult to walk around.
The place may be of interest to some foreign tourists but for Indians i don't think it would be of any great interest.

tripreview.Title: "Bargain hard"
tripreview.sentence: If you're a visitor to India, Your experience here depends on your experience of India and whether or not you've learned to haggle.
There are plenty of shops with all sorts of fascinating trinkets and antiques for sale but you should know your stuff if you think you're buying an antique .
There aren't many places you can go for an afternoons antiquing in india and this is one of them, just remember the salesman are super smooth .

tripreview.Title: "Worth checking out!"
tripreview.sentence: I never expected to see a historic Jewish town in the middle of India but what a fun surprise it was.
Great little area to walk around, see the synagogue, and shop.

tripreview.Title: "Interesting - but not a lot to see and not able to take photos"
tripreview.sentence: The buildings were interesting and the exhibits too, it was a very quick visit not even an hour.

tripreview.Title: "Very interesting"
tripreview.sentence: Our guide took us through back alleys to avoid the tourist crowds which in itself was interesting.

tripreview.Title: "Great experiance"
tripreview.sentence: Great place to walk about.
Lots of small shops.
Few things to keep in mind as this is a very busy place, keep all your belongings safe with you.
Never pay more than 50 Rupees for any Tuk Tuk (Riksha's) They often rip you off.
All short trips should only cost 20 to 30 rupees.

tripreview.Title: "Pleasant shop keepers, nice selection, decent prices"
tripreview.sentence: I'm not much of a shopper, but I get to accompany my wife who is quite good at it, and the shops and shopkeepers here are eager to invite you in, but every place we entered we were treated respectfully and weren't pressured in an unattractive way.

I'm no expert on what one pays at various other markets in town, but nothing here seemed off the scale expensive, and certainly compared to similar items outside of India, everything seemed very well priced and decent quality.

tripreview.Title: "Touristy but nice"
tripreview.sentence: Lots of colourful shops and galleries.
Unfortunately the synagogue was closed.
Find the huge snake boat in one gallery and the largest cooking vessel in the world in another!
And then find the crafters (they have 5 stores) warehouse - an antique treasure trove - huge!

tripreview.Title: "Renew our vows"
tripreview.sentence: We had planned our trip to India for over a year It was our 30th wedding anniversary and my sixth birthday After sight seeing in the golden triangle we planned on relaxing in the south and enjoying the weather and massages Our amazing guide arranged for us to have the synagogue all to our selves We had traditional Indian wedding outfits made and everybody in Jew town cheered us on as we walked down Jew town towards this beautiful old synagogue.

tripreview.Title: "An interesting place "
tripreview.sentence: Learn about the history of the jewish community is amazing.
understand how jews arrived in the area and why?

tripreview.Title: "Super area of Cochin"
tripreview.sentence: We visited Mattancherry, Jew town, to go to Dutch Palace and the synagogue.
Unfortunately the Dutch Palace is closed on Fridays, so we couldn't visit the museum and only see the building and grounds from the outside.
As we are Dutch it was nice to see and understand how we have been part of India's history.
The building and grounds itself are not super special.
Synagogue is certainly worth a visit.
Many nice tourist shops in the area.
Worth to visit Niyamaara for Aryuvedic clothing and we had drinks in a very nice art shop just around the corner.
Pleasant surroundings to wonder around.

tripreview.Title: "no longer very Jewish"
tripreview.sentence: Now that the Jewish community of Cochin is so diminished, Jew Town and the synagogue feel rather sad.
It is also a shame to see all the small spice warehouses of the area in the past now turned into tourist tat shops.

tripreview.Title: "Buzzling shopping district"
tripreview.sentence: It is hot, lot of shops and owners intensely trying to catch you!
If you ar not a shopaholic, it can be a bit too much.
A nice retaurant by the waterfront inside an antique shop.

tripreview.Title: "Facsinating glimpse into what life was like for the Jewish Community many years ago"
tripreview.sentence: So interesting to walk around and see the signs of a time when Jewish families occupied this area of Cochin.

tripreview.Title: "Passage of history and amazing buildings"
tripreview.sentence: The only difficulty was it was such a hot day to walk through.
But we were met by an unexpected,nice surprise about how historic and beautifully unique many of the old buildings were.

tripreview.Title: "Good old shopping style, but over priced"
tripreview.sentence: A good walking and shopping tour, all shops are made only for tourists, over priced.
Many shops might offer duplicate and cheap selection of items.
Few good shops offer large old collection of handicrafts.

tripreview.Title: "Despite the pushy vendors, worth the visit"
tripreview.sentence: Lots of lovely little shops selling spices, clothes, art, trinkets, etc.
Enjoyed walking around but vendors were a bit pushy despite signs that say "Hassle-free" shopping!

tripreview.Title: "A nice insight into jewish life!"
tripreview.sentence: The street are beautiful but the jewish presence has almost disappeared.
Maybe the govt should rename this place as Kashmiri town now.
Also they need to allow tourists to take photographs inside the synagogue.
Sarah Cohen's shop is an authentic place to buy jewish handicrafts.

tripreview.Title: "very nice"
tripreview.sentence: You will find plenty of of tourist shops on the both sides of the roads .
shops selling handicrafts, books You can visit few more places like Fort Kochi beach .

tripreview.Title: "Interesting"
tripreview.sentence: Traffic and parking is a nightmare here, it is best to get a rickshaw and ask him to wait for you, while you walk around.

tripreview.Title: "Must visit"
tripreview.sentence: This is place which long back belonged to the Jews and we have a Jew church and lot of antique shops around.
The museum there is also a must see one.

tripreview.Title: "A small walk"
tripreview.sentence: This is small walk with shops on both sides of the road.
But if you neglect the heat and urge to look into glass windows of antique (?
) shop then you will realize that this street and buildings are very old and very special.

tripreview.Title: "Lovely place, with fun shopping district"
tripreview.sentence: Great little town, lovely shops full of souvenirs and cheap clothes.
I would recommend having a coffee and enjoying the quaint streets, and the nice buildings.
Read about the history of the jewish community in Cochin and visit the synagogue nearby!

tripreview.Title: "Very nice"
tripreview.sentence: So many of the shops in India have the same type of "stuff" for sale in them.
Much of it nice and pleasant but so much of the same.
Jew Town did provide a bit of a change from that.
There were still plenty of Kashmiri textiles, bronze Ganehse's, camel bone boxes, and paper machie boxes to be seen, but there were more stores here that had some truly funky and unusual items.
So if you like to poke through antiques and curious shops this would be a part of town for you to visit!

tripreview.Title: "Crafters! Three hours in heaven!"
tripreview.sentence: Went to Jew town specifically to visit Crafters.
Their five shops, in the same area, stock the most amazing collection of furniture, artifacts and antiques!
Visited their storage area which is like Alladin's cave, for those who love such things.
The jewelry collection is also good.
One of the shops has the world's largest urli.
It was wonderful talking to the owners.
Their passion for their business is indeed commendable.
They ship to whichever place you want.
Would love to back once again

tripreview.Title: "Completely different experience"
tripreview.sentence: This place has a lovely feel to it.
Its a old locality and you can feel it in your breath.
the shopping is very exciting.
The spices the embroidered clothes
there is a police museum also on the way.
The museum also is pretty good showcasing the uniform and weapons of yesteryears.

tripreview.Title: "Historic Jew Town Cochin"
tripreview.sentence: This small section of Cochin was populated by Jews hundreds of years ago, but the synagogue still stands, as do the market streets (now rn my Muslims from Kashmir).
Intersting visit for an hour or two.

tripreview.Title: "Nice walk"
tripreview.sentence: Nice shopping along the way to the synagogue.
Friendly shopkeepers selling their wares.
If hot duck inside a shop have a seat and look at beautiful silver jewelry, shawls, tunic tops whatever.
Can be a hard sell but heck it's India offer half or less with a smile, shopkeepers smile too.

tripreview.Title: "Wonderful Synagogue and Kashmiri Islamic Shopkeepers worth a visit"
tripreview.sentence: This is a street leading to the synagogue lined with young aggressive Kashmiri shopholders selling their wears.
The tourists left Kashmir, so their fathers sent them here to find the tourists.
They don't enjoy the hot weather!

tripreview.Title: "Nice antiques"
tripreview.sentence: Here you can see where all the stuff in Europe Comedy from
don't forget to bargain.
don't forget to bargain.
